Reviews.Title: Fast Well Built Laptop
Reviews.Author: Brian Casterlin
Reviews.Content: Fast i7 quad well built,  I will Air travel with with my lightweight older dual core. But this is a powerhouse of a Desktop replacement.  If you travel by car I don't Imagine the size will be much of an issue.  Great features.

Reviews.Title: ThinkPad W530 24384KU 15.6" LED Notebook - Intel - Core i7 i7-3630QM 2.4GHz...
Reviews.Author: Petert
Reviews.Content: I ordered this laptop for my wife. I presently own (about 3 years) a ThinkPad T520, which has given me excellent service. After reading the reviews of this model and the newer models on Amazon, I decided on this one. So far it has performed as expected and my wife & I could not be happier. Highly Recommend this model.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertized.
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey
Reviews.Content: Has all the features I needed and preforms to the specs as advertized. It's a bit heavy but due to the 9 cell battery. But I'm not lugging it around an airport.

Reviews.Title: great laptop. 90% fit to me :)
Reviews.Author: mindaugas
Reviews.Content: i bought this laptop because it's durable, grate processor and long life battery. it's great for my job! (this is second lenovo laptop which i have)keyboard light is good, but i can see bulbs so it's not very good :) the bulb on top of the screen is great idea ;)i suggested this laptop to my friends,

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Ka Sundance
Reviews.Content: Best laptop I ever owned!It is soooo fast!Finally I can do my video editing in light speed!Highly recommnded

Reviews.Title: I liked it
Reviews.Author: mokoe
Reviews.Content: I have had it for 2 months, and it is a great computer. It arrived on time and everything seem to be working well as at now.

Reviews.Title: GREAT LAPTOP
Reviews.Author: Guanshen He
Reviews.Content: SO FAR LOVE IT! FIRST THINKPAD I HAVE AND ABSOLUTELY GORGEOUS. CONSIDERING THE PRICE OF THIS (ALTHOUGH 1 GEN BEFORE)

Reviews.Title: Love This Computer
Reviews.Author: TheMule77d
Reviews.Content: Amazing computer.  3rd Lenovo I have had in the past 8 years.  I worked one to death, and needed an upgrade over the other, which is 5 years old and still works.  The W530 is a wonderful computer.

Reviews.Title: good seller and good laptop
Reviews.Author: Zhiyuan Zong
Reviews.Content: The customer sevice is good and the delivery is very quickly. The quality of the laptop is good although its weight is a little heavy due to its special battery and power adapter.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this laptop
Reviews.Author: lambpear
Reviews.Content: Pro's - The specs for price is pretty great. The graphics card hogs a lot of energy but allows for multi monitor support from a dock, so you can place it down and use mulit monitors (only in windows), and rip it up.Keyboard is awesomeCon's - Here we go!Screen - fishnet effect, awkwardly lit and the 1920x1080 res does not do much when you can see a grid from a normal distance from the computer.Battery Life - Terrible, at most maybe a 4hr battery life, and I am not even playing games! even with a text editor and chrome up the bl is crap. I have the 9-cell battery and it acts like a 6 cell.

Reviews.Title: Excellent. Much better than Alienware
Reviews.Author: Huang
Reviews.Content: It has very high running speed. And less possible to be broke down. Very reliable. I'll recommend my friend this.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop for work!
Reviews.Author: Jose Gei Alvarado
Reviews.Content: I received my laptop a week ago and so far my W530 has been great. Its somewhat big and heavy, but it is a sturdy, well built machine and that's best for me. I'm an architect so I will be doing a lot of CAD and 3D work, and the Nvidia Quadro seems to perform very well, as expected since it's supposed to be optimized for this type of applications. Great price when compared to other mobile workstations from Dell, HP, and others. I will probably install additional RAM and maybe an SSD drive in the future.

Reviews.Title: Low end model, low resolution display, beware keyboards are a bit fragile
Reviews.Author: Dave C
Reviews.Content: This machine arrived properly packed, but as soon as I opened the lid, the backslash / pipe key fell out, it was totally loose. I figured I would deal with returning it later as I wanted to verify Linux would run cleanly, which it does (Ubuntu 13.10 booted from DVD-R).I had a much bigger issue with it: I had wanted one with a 1920x1080 display and a real graphics chip, not the Intel all-in-1 and a 1600x900 display of this model. Like a car, laptops come with a bewidlering variety of options within a single model name like W530. ThinkPads (since the IBM days) have a build code which specifies exactly how the machine is configured. I was apparently careless with the build code, the one I wanted is 24384CU and this is 24384KU. I've been burned by this once before in the late 90's, when IBM made the codes for 2 very different models very similar. Amazon unhelpfully puts this information below the fold and having surfed and looked at specs until I couldn't see straight, I decided on a model, searched and clicked, and Amazon's search must have broken the build code into numeric and alpha parts and offered up the wrong one. I just found the last CU on Amazon and bought it, and the KU with its broken key is going back.Every seller knows the display is a major part of the spec, the 1920x1080 display adds $200+ to the price, and every one seemingly tries to obfuscate the display resolution. I thought I was getting a bargain on new-old stock (the W540 has been out for a while) and instead I was paying full list for new-old stock.If you're gonna mostly use it docked, 1600x900 might float your boat, but I use my machine as-is on-site at clients' premises for work in the software / internet business, and I need the resolution. That does not detract from it being a ThinkPad, the case and engineering are the same as my 3.5+ year old W510 (with beautiful 1920x1080 AMOLED screen) on which I am typing this. Between work, personal use and buying them for the wife for college, I have owned 17 ThinkPads over the last 20 years, the W530 will make it 18, and I think that states my opinion on the product line. Lenovo has in general kept up IBM's legendary quality. When I have managed IT in the past, I have had a ThinkPad-only policy, they are durable and easy to support and maintain.I've seen people complaining about the keyboard quality on the W540, and I concur it's not as good as the older one I have, but having had hands on one, I feel pretty good about having ordered a(nother) W530 because it types so nicely. I use my ThinkPads very hard and I have replaced a number of keyboards, including one on my W510, which is still in excellent condition and going to a friend. ThinkPad parts are affordable and easy to install.A key feature of the W5x0 series rarely found outside huge workstation models is 4 DIMM slots, these come with 8GB and two free slots which is handy.

Reviews.Title: Rip off
Reviews.Author: Eric A. Hardt "Eric Hardt"
Reviews.Content: I am sad to write a negative review for one of my favorite brands. If you have a docking station and numerous AC power adapters because they were so nicely interchangeable, then you are up for a surprise. This product needs it's own power supply and docking station. If you rely on the docking station and need a spare power supply, then this product easily becomes $300 more expensive!I do understand the need for a larger power supply due to the quad processor, but I do not understand why this would also require different accessories for this laptop.Please understand that I am not just rating the W530 laptop itself, but rather the laptop compatibility with existing accessories, which I believe is an important criteria.Hopefully Lenovo will address those issues before another brand becomes my favorite.

Reviews.Title: screen is broken
Reviews.Author: linyuanjia
Reviews.Content: when i  open it at first time. i found the screen is flashing , i'm sure something in the screen is broken. i feel disappointed.

Reviews.Title: i add a 120g m5p ssd
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: i added a 120g m5p ssd from dvd bay. i formated the old system and reinstall win7 system.i encountered one time system freeze since today, and then i upgraded intel chip driver(can bus driver missing after the system freeze).so far so good. i use many thinkpad laptops but i still cannot get used to the keyboard. There is no capital led, of course i disable the touch panel which can cause a lot of wrong input.

Reviews.Title: Falling apart after warranty
Reviews.Author: Amanda M Jacobson
Reviews.Content: The w530 comes with a 12 month warranty. At 13 months I started having issues - USB 3's and VGA stopped working, crash dumping for no reason, built in mouse freezes constantly, and ever slower startup.I tried system restore using the built in recovery, but it won't launch. Called Lenovo and they won't provide any assistance since warranty has expired; all they offer is to PURCHASE recovery disks. When I asked to speak with a manager I was denied for not having a current warranty.While the computer worked well it was nice, but definitely not worth the money long-term. Also, no HDMI port is a huge pain.

ProductInfo.Features:
In the Box - Lenovo ThinkPad W530, 9-cell Li-on Battery Pack (up to 12.8 hours), AC Adapter, Preinstalled Software - Windows 7 Professional 64 Edition is preinstalled through downgrade rights with Microsoft Windows 8 Pro 64-bit
Intel Core i7-3630QM 2.4GHz Quad-Core Processor with Turbo Boost Technology 2.0 up to 3.4GHz, 6MB Smart Cache
3 Year Warranty
8GB PC3-12800 1600MHz DDR3 RAM
500GB 7200RPM Hard Drive
ProductInfo.Name: ThinkPad W530 24384KU 15.6" LED Notebook - Intel - Core i7 i7-3630QM 2.4GHz
